stimulusHtml: An astronaut jumps from the surface of the Moon and follows the path shown by the dashed line. At Point P, the astronaut is at the highest point in the path. Air resistance is negligible. Is the astronaut in equilibrium? Why or why not?
choicesHtml: Yes, because the astronaut only has a constant horizontal velocity.
Yes, because the astronaut’s vertical velocity is instantaneously zero.
No, because the astronaut has a component of velocity in the horizontal direction.
No, because there is a downward net force on the astronaut.
